recipe_name: Baked Camembert with garlic, thyme, maple syrup and toast soldiers
author: James Tanner
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Remove the Camembert from its packaging, pierce the top of the cheese with a sharp knife, then stuff the incisions with the garlic, thyme and drizzle with maple syrup. Wrap the cheese in aluminium foil and place back into the wooden box.  Place on a baking sheet in the oven and bake for ten minutes. Brush the bread with the olive oil, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and griddle in a hot griddle pan until golden-brown on both sides. Cut into soldiers. To serve, place the whole Camembert onto a serving plate and unwrap the foil. Serve with the cooked carrots and toast soldiers on the side for dipping into the cheese.
ingredients: 1 whole small Camembert cheese (in a wooden box),  2 cloves garlic, sliced,  1 tbsp maple syrup,  2 sprigs fresh thyme,  2 slices crusty white bread,  olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  small handful Chantenay carrots (or other small carrots), cooked
